data.text:
@BlueCheese608 @WalkerBragman Your reasoning:

“If they would have only allowed mass death and hospitalization in the first place then they would have prevented mass death and hospitalization” 🤦‍♂️

@WalkerBragman @Terry_Mitchell Shocker!

Another country that followed the ...

G  reenwald
B  lumenthal
D  ore

... plan is infested with virus, sickness, debilitating disease and death.
@job_gyhb @WalkerBragman Nonsense. Vaccine introduced herd immunity has always been achievable. Our problem is that we keep relaxing NPIs before that is achieved

@AubryPeters @WalkerBragman How does that work? A lockdown doesn’t mean people don’t live with other people. You still need cops, nurses, bus drivers and people to cook your food. You cannot lock down to the literal sense of the word
@WalkerBragman Looks like your New Zealand narrative got shot to hell. https://t.co/hz8dHQ4one
@Nixonchesthair @WalkerBragman So if everyone infected runs their course in lockdown and isn’t contagious, how would it spread?

@BlueCheese608 @WalkerBragman So you’d clean up HIV+ blood without gloves?

You’d have unprotected sex with someone with Syphilis?

You’d make out with someone with Ebola?

Because of “natural immunity”, right?
@job_gyhb @WalkerBragman Yes, because the elites need us working and buying things to make them more money.
